Sentencas: Oxide ion conducting ceramics have attracted much attention due to their various applications such as solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOECs) and solid-oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Improved oxide-ion conductivity by substitution of Sr for Bi in Dion-Jacobson phase CsBi2Ti2NbO10

Sentencas: Herein, we present the first report on the preparation, electrical and structural properties of oxide-ion conducting Dion-Jacobson phases CsBi1.9M0.1-Ti2NbO9.95 (M = Mg, Ca, Sr and Ba).
Titulo: Improved oxide-ion conductivity by substitution of Sr for Bi in Dion-Jacobson phase CsBi2Ti2NbO10

Sentencas: It was found that partial substitution of Bi3+ by Sr2+ improves the conductivity of CsBi2Ti2NbO10.
Titulo: Improved oxide-ion conductivity by substitution of Sr for Bi in Dion-Jacobson phase CsBi2Ti2NbO10

Sentencas: The electrical conductivity of CsBi1.9Sr0.1Ti2NbO9.95 is approximately 2 times higher than that of CsBi2Ti2NbO10 at 600-900 degrees C and is 1.65 x 10(-2)
Titulo: Improved oxide-ion conductivity by substitution of Sr for Bi in Dion-Jacobson phase CsBi2Ti2NbO10
Improved oxide-ion conductivity by substitution of Sr for Bi in Dion-Jacobson phase CsBi2Ti2NbO10

Sentencas: The improvement of oxide-ion conductivity in CsBi1.9Sr0.1Ti2NbO9.95 can be attributed to the increase of the carrier (oxygen vacancy) concentration and small size mismatch between the dopant Sr and host Bi cations.
Titulo: Improved oxide-ion conductivity by substitution of Sr for Bi in Dion-Jacobson phase CsBi2Ti2NbO10

Sentencas: The electrical conductivities of CsBi1.9Sr0.1Ti2NbO9.95 are almost constant in the oxygen partial pressure region from 10(-25) to 1 atm at 600 degrees C, indicating the predominant oxide-ion conduction and high chemical and electrical stability.
Titulo: Improved oxide-ion conductivity by substitution of Sr for Bi in Dion-Jacobson phase CsBi2Ti2NbO10

Sentencas: Bond-valence-based energy landscapes of a test oxide ion in CsBi1.9Sr0.1Ti2NbO9.95 suggest that oxide ions migrate along the edges of the octahedra in the inner perovskite layers, leading to two-dimensional oxide-ion diffusion.
Titulo: Improved oxide-ion conductivity by substitution of Sr for Bi in Dion-Jacobson phase CsBi2Ti2NbO10

Sentencas: This study demonstrates the successful improvement of oxide-ion conductivity by the substitution in Dion-Jacobson phase, which would develop the science and technology of Dion-Jacobson type oxide-ion conductors.
Titulo: Improved oxide-ion conductivity by substitution of Sr for Bi in Dion-Jacobson phase CsBi2Ti2NbO10
